events.originalText: Russian forces launched an invasion of Ukraine in an escalation of the Russo-Ukrainian conflict.
events.subtitle: Russian invasion of Ukraine
events.headline: Russian forces invade Ukraine in escalation of conflict

events.originalText: United Airlines Flight 811 experienced uncontrolled decompression after leaving Honolulu International Airport, Hawaii, blowing seats out of the aircraft and killing nine passengers.
events.subtitle: United Airlines Flight 811
events.headline: United Airlines Flight 811 experiences fatal decompression after leaving Honolulu

events.originalText: Five men disappeared after attending a college basketball game in Chico, California; the bodies of four of them were discovered in June that year.
events.subtitle: Yuba County Five
events.headline: Five men disappear after college basketball game in Chico, California

events.originalText: Vietnam War: South Vietnamese forces led by Ngô Quang Trưởng recaptured the citadel of Huế.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: South Vietnamese forces recapture Huế citadel in Vietnam War

events.originalText: World War II: The Battle of Kasserine Pass, the first major engagement between American and Axis forces in Africa, ended with the Allied forces suffering heavy losses.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Battle of Kasserine Pass ends with heavy losses for Allied forces in Africa

events.originalText: World War II: Eyewitness reports of unidentified flying objects over Los Angeles triggered a massive anti-aircraft artillery barrage under the belief it was a Japanese attack.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Eyewitness reports of UFOs trigger anti-aircraft barrage in Los Angeles during WWII

events.originalText: Andrew Johnson became the first U.S. president to be impeached.
events.subtitle: Andrew Johnson
events.headline: Andrew Johnson impeached as U.S. president

events.originalText: The Treaty of Yandabo was signed, ending the First Anglo-Burmese War, the longest and most expensive war in the history of British India.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Yandabo
events.headline: Treaty of Yandabo signed, ending First Anglo-Burmese War

events.originalText: After having stood for only 15 years, London's Theatre Royal, Drury Lane (pictured), the third building of that name, burned down.
events.subtitle: Theatre Royal, Drury Lane
events.headline: Theatre Royal, Drury Lane in London burns down after 15 years

events.originalText: In Marbury v. Madison, the Supreme Court declared an act of Congress unconstitutional for the first time, forming the basis of judicial review in the United States.
events.subtitle: Marbury v. Madison
events.headline: Supreme Court declares act of Congress unconstitutional in Marbury v. Madison

events.originalText: War of the Quadruple Alliance: Spanish forces began a failed assault on the British settlement of Nassau in the Bahamas.
events.subtitle: War of the Quadruple Alliance
events.headline: Spanish forces fail in assault on British settlement of Nassau in War of the Quadruple Alliance

events.originalText: George Frideric Handel's Rinaldo, the first Italian-language opera written specifically for the London stage, premiered.
events.subtitle: George Frideric Handel
events.headline: Handel's Rinaldo premieres as first Italian-language opera for London stage

events.originalText: Italian composer Claudio Monteverdi's L'Orfeo, considered the first fully developed opera, premiered in Mantua.
events.subtitle: Claudio Monteverdi
events.headline: Monteverdi's L'Orfeo premieres in Mantua as first fully developed opera

events.originalText: The Diocletianic Persecution, the last and most severe episode of the persecution of Christians in the Roman Empire, began with the publication of a first edict by Roman emperor Diocletian.
events.subtitle: Diocletianic Persecution
events.headline: Diocletianic Persecution begins with edict by Roman emperor Diocletian
